thread.title: Man United roasted as Liverpool push them down the table beating Spurs
thread.title_full: Man United roasted as Liverpool push them down the table beating Spurs

title: Man United roasted as Liverpool push them down the table beating Spurs
text:
Man United roasted as Liverpool push them down the table By Benjamin Newman on Saturday, February 11, 2017 Liverpool 2 – Tottenham 0 
Liverpool returned to winning ways in the Premier League on Saturday, as the Reds beat Tottenham 2-0 at Anfield. 
All the damage was done in the first half, as Sadio Mane reminded the hoe fans what they’d been missing while he was at the African Cup of Nations with Senegal. 
Mane was explosive in the opening forty-five minutes as Spurs fans complained about Ben Davies not being Danny Rose, and questioning Eric Dier’s form as well. 
The Liverpool forward scored twice in quick succession from assists from Gini Wijnaldum and Roberto Firmino. 
The tempo of the game wasn’t as good in the second half as Spurs failed to find a way back into the game. Man United roasted as Liverpool push them down the table 
The upshot of Liverpool’s win was that Jurgen Klopp’s side held onto fifth place in the Premier League. 
It also meant that Man United remain in sixth spot after round 25 of the campaign. 
That lead to plenty of comments on social media. 
Enjoy the Liverpool v Man United banter below. Opposition fans gleefully declaring that United are still 6th but ignoring that we've closed the gap on 2nd to 2pts (as it stands). Manchester United spent about half an hour in 5th place. 
Back to 6th they go. pic.twitter.com/n4AJz6jdO4
